speed.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the rate at which something moves or travels
speed.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The truck was travelling at a speed of 50 mph.
particles that travel at the speed of light.
speed.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually talk about how fast something or someone is rather than using the noun speed:
speed.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the rate at which something happens or is done
speed.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The population was growing at great speed.
the speed of change within the industry
speed.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The womenâ€™s basketball team has talent, speed, and power.
She acted with speed and efficiency.
speed.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the degree to which photographic film is sensitive to light
speed.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the time it takes for a camera shutter to open and close
speed.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: an illegal drug that makes you very active
speed.translation[0].note_box[0].section: He increased his speed until he was running flat out.
The Mercedes was gradually picking up speed.
The trains will reach speeds of 140 mph.
The aircraft is designed to maintain a steady speed.
She reduced speed as she approached the village.
The engine made a strange sound and we lost speed.
The disc revolves at a constant speed.
The car has a top speed of 132 mph.
The average wind speed will be about 14 knots.
The train was travelling at high speed.
Even at low speed, an accident could mean serious injury for a child.
He ran past us at full speed.
He moved with his usual lightning speed.
He drove away at breakneck speed.
The speed limit is 40 mph here.
New speed restrictions have been introduced.
Most GPS systems will warn you when there are speed cameras.
speed.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The car sped along the dusty highway.
speed.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to take someone or something somewhere very quickly
speed.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: An ambulance sped her to the hospital.
speed.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: This news should speed his recovery.
